$CTAB.text:
*- AMUP-3.1  Element of CTAB - Name table for CSECT
*CTAB    DSECT
*-
C#NEXT   DS    A                       Next element or 0
C#ADDR   DS    A                       Offset of CSECT in program
C#SIZE   DS    A                       Size of CSECT
C#NTAB   DS    A                       Addr of NTAB chain or 0
C#DTAB   DS    A                       Addr of DTAB chain or 0
C#BADDR  DS    A                       Base offset
C#BREG   DS    X                       Base reg #
C#TYPE1  DS    X                       Name table type
C#TYPE   DS    X                       Element type (see below)
         DS    X                       reserved
C#NAME   DS    CL8                     Name of CSECT
C#SSI    DS    XL4                     Compile date (3 bytes packed)
         DS    0F
C#LENGTH EQU   *-CTAB                  Element size
         ORG   C#BADDR
C#BASE   DS    A                For LR only - Addr of CSECT.CTAB
* Values for C#TYPE1: Name table type
C##NULL  EQU   0                       No name table
C##SYM   EQU   C'A'                    Assembler: SYM
C##SYMDB EQU   C'F'                    FOPTPAH: SYMDB
*
*- Valid values for C#TYPE: types of CTAB elements:
SD       EQU   X'00'                   SECTION DEFINITION (CSECT)
LR       EQU   X'03'                   LABEL REFERENCE (entry point)
PC       EQU   X'04'                   PRIVATE CODE (unnamed section)
CM       EQU   X'05'                   COMMON (common block)
*- Invalid values for C#TYPE:
*        EQU   X'01'                   ?
*        EQU   X'02'                   EXTERNAL REFERENCE
*        EQU   X'06'                   PSEUDO REGISTERS
*        EQU   X'07'                   NULL
*        EQU   X'0A'                   WEAK EXTERNAL REFERENCE

$DTAB.text:
*- AMUP-3.1  Element of DTAB - name table for DSECT
*DTAB    DSECT
*-
D#NEXT   DS    A                       Next element or CTAB
D#ADDR   DS    A                       reserved
D#SIZE   DS    A                       D Section size
D#NTAB   DS    A                       Addr of 1st NTAB or 0
D#CTAB   DS    A                       Addr of home CTAB
D#BADDR  DS    A                       Base address
         ORG   D#BADDR
D#BASE   DS    A
D#NAME   DS    CL8                     DSECT name
D#BREG   DS    X                       Base register #
         DS    3X                      reserv
D#LENGTH EQU   *-DTAB                  Element size

$NTAB.text:
*- AMUP-3.1  Element of NTAB, name table for internal names
*NTAB    DSECT
*-
N#NEXT   DS    A                       Next NTAB
N#ADDR   DS    A                       Offset of field in CSECT
N#SIZE   DS    A                       Size of field
N#DIM    DS    F                       Number of entries in array or 1
N#R1     DS    A                       reserved
N#INT    DS    H                       record length (data structure)
N#TYPE   DS    CL1                     Type of field
N#NMLN   DS    XL1            0. or: Length of name (for var lengths)
N#NAME   DS    CL8                     Name of field
N#LENGTH EQU   *-NTAB                  Element size
*- Element types:
*1.Data type: C'CXBXFHEDAYSVPZL'
*Z#CHAR   EQU   'C'                    STRING
*Z#HEX    EQU   'X'                    STRING
*Z#BIT    EQU   'B'                    STRING
*Z#FULL   EQU   'F'
*Z#HALF   EQU   'H'
*Z#REAL   EQU   'E'
*Z#DOUBLE EQU   'D'
*Z#AADDR  EQU   'A'
*Z#YADDR  EQU   'Y'
*Z#SADDR  EQU   'S'
*Z#VADDR  EQU   'V'
*Z#PACK   EQU   'P'
*Z#ZONE   EQU   'Z'
*Z#LONG   EQU   'L'
*2. Non-data types (Converted to digits):
Z#BLANK  EQU   C'0'                    blank (STRING)
Z#CSECT  EQU   C'1'                    section
Z#DSECT  EQU   C'2'                    fiction section
Z#COMMON EQU   C'3'                    common
Z#STMT   EQU   C'4'                    machine instruction
Z#CCW    EQU   C'5'                    CCW
Z#EQU    EQU   C'6'                    relocatable EQU

$PARM.text:
MACRO
***********************************************************************
* Parameter DSECT for $OPEN program
* Dynamic OPEN/READ/WRITE/CLOSE
* SVM 12/19/2002 - re-created
***********************************************************************
         $PARM
         SPACE 1
.*- Parm mapping for $OPEN:
$PARM    DSECT
RC       DS   F                       <Return Code
DSNAME   DS   CL44                    >Dataset Name
MEMBER   DS   CL8                     >PDS Member Name (optional)
VOLUME   DS   CL6                    <>Volume Name     (optional)
RECLEN   DS   H                      < Current Record Length
*TYPE     EQU   RECLEN            work  Open type (for OPEN only)
DCBADDR  DS   A                      <>DCB Address
OLDTYPE  EQU   DCBADDR               < After OPEN (saved TYPE)
BUFADDR  DS   A                      <>Buffer Address
LENGTH   DS   F                      < Data Length in Buffer (bytes)
RECADDR  DS   A                      < Current Record Addr
         SPACE 1
         MEND

$PTAB.text:
*- ITS-3.1  Element of program table PTAB: (see $PTAB0 !)
&$ASIZE  SETA 32768                    name area size, words
*PTAB    DSECT
*-
P#NEXT   DC    A(0)             Next PTAB (looped) or 0
P#ADDR   DC    A(0)                    Addr of program in RAM
P#SIZE   DC    F'0'                    Size of program
P#ENTRY  DC    A(0)                    Entry offset
P#CTAB   DC    A(0)                    Addr of 1st CTAB or 0
P#ASIZE  DC    F'&$ASIZE'              Size of P#DATA, words
P#AFREE  DC    A(P#DATA)               Addr of free area
P#AEND   DC    A(P#END)                Addr of end of data
P#NAME   DC    CL8' '                  Program name
P#DSN    DC    CL44' '                 Load library name
P#VOL    DC    CL6' '                  Volume name
P#SSI    DC    XL4'00'                 SSI from BLDL for program
P#ACODE  DC    X'00'                   Auth Code
P#ATR1   DC    X'00'                   PDS2ATR1
P#ATR2   DC    X'00'                   PDS2ATR2
P#FLAG   DC    X'00'                   bit0 - AMODE=31
P#ANAME  DC    C'        '             alias member/entry name
P#AENTRY DC    A(0)                    alias entry offset
*                                      bit1 - RMODE=ANY
*                                      bit2 - bit7 - reserved
P#LENGTH EQU   P#DATA-PTAB             Size of element
P#DATA   DC    &$ASIZE.A(0)            Data area for CTAB, NTAB, DTAB
P#END    EQU   *
P#DLEN   EQU   4*&$ASIZE               P#DATA length in bytes

$RLD.text:
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* RLD, CRLD record mapping:                                           *
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
RLDREC   DSECT
RL#TYPE  DS    X                       record type
* RL#TYPE values:
RL#RLD   EQU   X'02'                   RLD record
RL#OV    EQU   X'06'                   Last RLD for OV segment
RL#LAST  EQU   X'0E'                   Last record for module
RL#CRLD  EQU   X'03'                   CRLD record
RL#COV   EQU   X'07'                   Last CRLD for OV segment
RL#CLAST EQU   X'0F'                   Next TXT - last for the module
*
RL#NULL  DS    XL3                     null
RL#CRCNT DS    H                       Size of CR-field, bytes
RL#RLCNT DS    H                       Size of RLD-field, bytes
RL#CCW   DS    D                       CCW
RL#DATA  EQU   *                       Start of RLD data

$RLDATA.text:
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* RLD data mapping:
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
RLDATA   DSECT
* Triplets: (R,R,(F,A))
RD#R     DS    H                       # of ESD, referred to
RD#P     DS    H                       # of ESD, referred from
* Words: (F,A)
RD#F     DS    X                       FLAG: XXXXLLST, GDE:
RD#A     DS    AL3                     Offset of the const in module
*
* XXXX - type of address constant:
*        0000 - A-const
*        0001 - V-const
*        0010 - pseudoregister offset
*        0011 - cumm pseudoregister offset
*        1000, 1001 - nonrelocable, refers to                           HUY
*                    nonresolved external reference
* LL   - length of address constant:
*        01   - 2 bytes
*        10   - 3 bytes
*        11   - 4 bytes
*
* S    - relocation direction:
*        0    - positive
*        1    - negative
*
* T    - Flag passing to next (R,P):
*        0    - last constant of current couple (R,P)
*        1    - not last   """
*

BEGIN.text:
.* A=24/31,   R=24/31/ANY
.*
         MACRO
&NAME    BEGIN &A=31,&R=ANY
&NAME    CSECT
         AIF   ('&A' NE '24' AND '&A' NE '31' AND '&A' NE 'ANY').NOA
&NAME    AMODE &A
.NOA     ANOP
         AIF   ('&R' NE '24' AND '&R' NE '31' AND '&R' NE 'ANY').NOR
&NAME    RMODE &R
.NOR     ANOP
         B     28(R15)
         DC    CL9'&NAME'
         DC    CL9'&SYSDATE'
         DC    CL6'&SYSTIME'
         STM   14,12,12(13)            Save Registers
         LR    12,15                   LOAD ADDRESS OF ENTRY POINT
         USING &NAME,12                R12 BASE REGISTER
         EJECT
         MEND

FIN.text:
MACRO
&NAME    FIN
         GBLC  &###L
&NAME    LR    3,13                SAVE NEW
         L     13,4(3)             RESTORE OLD
         LR    2,15                SAVE RC
         FREEMAIN RU,A=(3),LV=&###L
         LR    15,2                RESTORE RC
*        RETURN (14,12),RC=(15)
         L     14,12(0,13)
         LM    0,12,20(13)
         BSM   0,14
         MEND

PAR0010.text:
MACRO
***********************************************************************
* Parameter DSECT for SVMxx10 module
* Get UserID authorisation level
* SVM 01/04/2001 - Created
***********************************************************************
         PAR0010
         SPACE 1
.*- Parm for SVM0010:
.*                        Input:
PUSER    DS     CL8         User ID
PDSN     DS     CL44        DSNAME
.*                        Output:
PRRET    DS     F           RACF return code
PRREA    DS     F           RACF reason code
PSFRC    DS     F           SAF  return code
PSFRS    DS     F           SAF  reason code
         MEND

REGS.text:
MACRO
         REGS  &TYPE=STANDARD
         GBLB  &GREGS
         AIF   (&GREGS).END      GENERATED ONLY ONCE
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*        Product STANDARD REGISTER EQUATES                            *
*                                                                     *
*        TYPE=STANDARD   R0-R15 GENERATED                             *
*        TYPE=EXTENDED   R0-R15, RA-RF GENERATED                      *
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
R0       EQU   0
R00      EQU   0
R1       EQU   1
R01      EQU   1
R2       EQU   2
R02      EQU   2
R3       EQU   3
R03      EQU   3
R4       EQU   4
R04      EQU   4
R5       EQU   5
R05      EQU   5
R6       EQU   6
R06      EQU   6
R7       EQU   7
R07      EQU   7
R8       EQU   8
R08      EQU   8
R9       EQU   9
R09      EQU   9
R10      EQU   10
R11      EQU   11
R12      EQU   12
R13      EQU   13
R14      EQU   14
R15      EQU   15
&GREGS   SETB  1                   SHOW REGISTERS GENERATED
         AIF   ('&TYPE' NE 'EXTENDED').END
         SPACE 1
RA       EQU   10
RB       EQU   11
RC       EQU   12
RD       EQU   13
RE       EQU   14
RF       EQU   15
.END     ANOP
         MEND

SAY.text:
.* SAY macro issues WTP to dump the value while debug.
.*    it is not re-entrant!
.* SAY TEXT,VALUE,LEN
.*    TEXT must be 'TEXT' or omitted, example: 'DATE = '
.*    VALUE may be either a name or (R) loaded with address
.*    examples: (R2), DATA122
.*    LEN is optional when VALUE is a name. Must be a numeric length
.*        of the VALUE. Required when VALUE is (r)
         MACRO
&NAME    SAY     &TEXT,&VALUE,&LEN
         GBLA    &SAY#
&SAY#    SETA    &SAY#+1
&NAME    DS    0H
&NAM     SETC    'SAY&SAY#'
.NAM     AIF     ('&TEXT' NE '').C00
.* -- empty TEXT - set length to 0
&TLEN    SETA    0
         AGO     .C0
.* -- text is not empty, must be in quotes:
.C00     ANOP
&TLEN    SETA    K'&TEXT-2             Length without quotes
&TXT     SETC    '&TEXT'
.C0      AIF     ('&VALUE' NE '').V00
.* -- empty Value - set length to 0
&PLEN    SETA    0
         AGO     .C1
.* -- value in not empty:
.V00     ANOP
&VAL     SETC    '&VALUE'
         AIF     ('&LEN' EQ '').NOLEN
.* -- Len present - check if Value is (register):
&PLEN    SETA    &LEN
         AIF     ('&VALUE'(1,1) NE '(').C1
.* -- value as a (register):
&VAL     SETC    '0&VALUE'
         AGO     .C1
.NOLEN   ANOP
&PLEN    SETA    L'&VALUE
.* -- Generate code:
.C1      ANOP
&MLEN    SETA    &TLEN+&PLEN
         AIF     ('&MLEN' EQ '0').END
         AIF     (&TLEN EQ 0).C11
         MVC     &NAM+8(&TLEN),=C&TXT
.C11     AIF     (&PLEN EQ 0).C12
         MVC     &NAM+8+&TLEN.(&PLEN),&VAL
.C12     ANOP
         CNOP    0,4
         MVI     *+9,&MLEN+4
&NAM     WTO     L&MLEN' ',ROUTCDE=11
.END     ANOP
         MEND

SVMPAR6.text:
MACRO
***********************************************************************
* Parameter DSECT for SVMALC6 module
* Dynalloc interface module
* SVM 03/03/2003 - added DSECT parm and optional dsn(member)
* SVM 12/19/2002 - re-created
***********************************************************************
&NAME    SVMPAR6 &DSECT=NO
         SPACE 1
* Parameter mapping for SVMALC6:
         AIF   ('&DSECT' NE 'YES').NODSECT
&NAME    DSECT
.NODSECT ANOP
TDDN     DS    CL8           Dynalloc-output, Unalloc-input
TDSORG   DS    XL2           Dynalloc-output, Unalloc-n/a
TDSN     DS    CL54          Dynalloc-input,  Unalloc-n/a
TVOL     DS    CL6           Dynalloc-input/output, Unalloc-n/a
TERR     DS    XL4           Both-Copy of S99ERROR and S99INFO
         SPACE 1
         MEND

SVM00000.text:
MACRO
*--------------------------------------------------------------------
* SVM00000 data module map
*--------------------------------------------------------------------
&NAME    SVM00000 &DSECT=NO
         AIF    ('&DSECT' EQ 'NO').NODSECT
&NAME    DSECT
.NODSECT ANOP
SVMHDR   DC     C'SVM00000'            header (eye catcher)
TIMECB   DC     F'0'                   for IRXF@FWT (L_FWT)
         DS     0D
         MEND

WORK.text:
MACRO
.*                                     LOC=BELOW or RES
&NAME    WORK  &LV=WRKLEN,&LOC=RES
         GBLC  &###L
&###L    SETC  '&LV'
         GETMAIN RU,LV=&###L,LOC=&LOC
         ST    13,4(1)             STORE OLD TO NEW
         ST    1,8(13)             STORE NEW TO OLD
         L     1,24(13)            RESTORE R1 FROM OLD
         L     0,20(13)            RESTORE R0 FROM OLD
         L     13,8(13)            RESET BASE FOR NEW
         USING &NAME,13
         MEND
